policy_title: Inflammatory Conditions – Infliximab Intravenous Products Prior Authorization Policy

AGE_GE_18.name: Age >= 18 years
AGE_GE_18.description: Patient is 18 years of age or older

AGE_GE_6.name: Age >= 6 years
AGE_GE_6.description: Patient is 6 years of age or older

PRESCRIBER_RHEUM.description: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with a rheumatologist
PRESCRIBER_RHEUM.policy_text: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with a rheumatologist

PRESCRIBER_GI.name: Prescribed by Gastroenterologist
PRESCRIBER_GI.description: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with a gastroenterologist
PRESCRIBER_GI.policy_text: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with a gastroenterologist

PRESCRIBER_DERM.policy_text: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with a dermatologist

PRESCRIBER_OPHTH.description: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with an ophthalmologist
PRESCRIBER_OPHTH.policy_text: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with an ophthalmologist

PRESCRIBER_ONC_HEM_TRANSPLANT.name: Prescribed by Oncologist/Hematologist/Transplant

PRESCRIBER_ONC_HEM_TRANSPLANT.policy_text: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with an oncologist, hematologist, or a physician affiliated with a transplant center

PRESCRIBER_MULTI_SPECIALTY_BEHCETS.name: Prescribed by Specialist (Behcet's)
PRESCRIBER_MULTI_SPECIALTY_BEHCETS.description: Prescribed by rheumatologist, dermatologist, ophthalmologist, gastroenterologist, or neurologist
PRESCRIBER_MULTI_SPECIALTY_BEHCETS.policy_text: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with a rheumatologist, dermatologist, ophthalmologist, gastroenterologist, or neurologist

PRESCRIBER_MULTI_SPECIALTY_SARCOID.name: Prescribed by Specialist (Sarcoidosis)
PRESCRIBER_MULTI_SPECIALTY_SARCOID.description: Prescribed by pulmonologist, ophthalmologist, cardiologist, neurologist, or dermatologist
PRESCRIBER_MULTI_SPECIALTY_SARCOID.policy_text: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with a pulmonologist, ophthalmologist, cardiologist, neurologist, or dermatologist

PRESCRIBER_MULTI_SPECIALTY_IMMUNO.description: Prescribed by oncologist, cardiologist, gastroenterologist, hematologist, nephrologist, pulmonologist, rheumatologist, or ophthalmologist
PRESCRIBER_MULTI_SPECIALTY_IMMUNO.policy_text: The medication is prescribed by or in consultation with an oncologist, cardiologist, gastroenterologist, hematologist, nephrologist, pulmonologist, rheumatologist, or ophthalmologist

DIAG_AS.name: Diagnosis of Ankylosing Spondylitis
DIAG_AS.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Ankylosing Spondylitis

clinical_codes.display: Ankylosing spondylitis of multiple sites in spine

DIAG_CD.name: Diagnosis of Crohn's Disease
DIAG_CD.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Crohn's Disease (any K50.x ICD-10 code including subtypes with fistula, obstruction, abscess)

clinical_codes.display: Crohn's disease of both small and large intestine
Crohn's disease of small intestine with fistula
Crohn's disease of large intestine with fistula
Crohn's disease of both small and large intestine with fistula

STEP_CD_STEROIDS.name: Trial of Corticosteroids (CD)
STEP_CD_STEROIDS.description: Patient has tried or is currently taking corticosteroids, or corticosteroids are contraindicated
STEP_CD_STEROIDS.policy_text: Patient has tried or is currently taking corticosteroids, or corticosteroids are contraindicated in this patient

STEP_CD_CONVENTIONAL.name: Trial of Conventional Systemic Therapy (CD)
STEP_CD_CONVENTIONAL.description: Patient has tried one other conventional systemic therapy for Crohn's disease (e.g., azathioprine, 6-mercaptopurine, methotrexate)
STEP_CD_CONVENTIONAL.policy_text: Patient has tried one other conventional systemic therapy for Crohn's disease

CLINICAL_CD_FISTULAS.name: Presence of Fistulas (Alternative to Step Therapy)
CLINICAL_CD_FISTULAS.description: Patient has enterocutaneous (perianal or abdominal) or rectovaginal fistulas - qualifies as alternative to conventional step therapy
CLINICAL_CD_FISTULAS.policy_text: Patient has enterocutaneous (perianal or abdominal) or rectovaginal fistulas

CLINICAL_CD_RESECTION.name: History of Ileocolonic Resection (Alternative to Step Therapy)
CLINICAL_CD_RESECTION.description: Patient had ileocolonic resection - qualifies as alternative to conventional step therapy to reduce recurrence risk

DIAG_PSO.name: Diagnosis of Plaque Psoriasis
DIAG_PSO.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Plaque Psoriasis

STEP_PSO_SYSTEMIC.name: Trial of Systemic Agent (PsO)
STEP_PSO_SYSTEMIC.description: Patient has tried at least one traditional systemic agent for psoriasis for at least 3 months, unless intolerant
STEP_PSO_SYSTEMIC.policy_text: Patient has tried at least one traditional systemic agent for psoriasis for at least 3 months, unless intolerant

STEP_PSO_PUVA.name: Trial of PUVA
STEP_PSO_PUVA.description: A 3-month trial of psoralen plus ultraviolet A light (PUVA)
STEP_PSO_PUVA.policy_text: A 3-month trial of psoralen plus ultraviolet A light (PUVA) also counts

CONTRAINDICATION_MTX.name: Contraindication to Methotrexate
CONTRAINDICATION_MTX.description: According to the prescriber, the patient has a contraindication to methotrexate
CONTRAINDICATION_MTX.policy_text: According to the prescriber, the patient has a contraindication to methotrexate

DIAG_PSA.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Psoriatic Arthritis

DIAG_RA.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Rheumatoid Arthritis

STEP_RA_DMARD.name: Trial of Conventional DMARD (RA)
STEP_RA_DMARD.description: Patient has tried ONE conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) for at least 3 months
STEP_RA_DMARD.policy_text: Patient has tried ONE conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) for at least 3 months

DIAG_UC.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Ulcerative Colitis

STEP_BEHCETS_CONVENTIONAL.description: Patient has tried at least ONE conventional therapy

CLINICAL_BEHCETS_OPHTHALMIC.description: Patient has ophthalmic manifestations of Behcet's disease

STEP_GVHD_SYSTEMIC.name: Trial of Systemic Medication (GVHD)
STEP_GVHD_SYSTEMIC.description: Patient has tried at least one systemic medication for graft-versus-host disease
STEP_GVHD_SYSTEMIC.policy_text: Patient has tried at least one systemic medication for graft-versus-host disease

DIAG_HS.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Hidradenitis Suppurativa

STEP_HS_THERAPY.description: Patient has tried one other therapy (e.g., corticosteroids, antibiotics, isotretinoin)
STEP_HS_THERAPY.policy_text: Patient has tried one other therapy

DIAG_IMMUNO_TOXICITY.name: Immunotherapy-Related Toxicity
DIAG_IMMUNO_TOXICITY.description: Patient developed an immunotherapy-related toxicity other than hepatitis while receiving a checkpoint inhibitor
DIAG_IMMUNO_TOXICITY.policy_text: According to the prescriber, patient developed an immunotherapy-related toxicity other than hepatitis; AND Patient developed this immunotherapy related toxicity while receiving a checkpoint inhibitor

STEP_IMMUNO_STEROID.description: Patient has tried one systemic corticosteroid
STEP_IMMUNO_STEROID.policy_text: Patient has tried one systemic corticosteroid

DIAG_INDETERMINATE_COLITIS.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Indeterminate Colitis

STEP_IC_STEROID.description: Patient has tried one systemic corticosteroid
STEP_IC_STEROID.policy_text: Patient has tried one systemic corticosteroid

STEP_IC_IMMUNOSUPPRESSANT.name: Trial of Immunosuppressant (IC)
STEP_IC_IMMUNOSUPPRESSANT.description: Patient has tried either azathioprine or 6-mercaptopurine
STEP_IC_IMMUNOSUPPRESSANT.policy_text: Patient has tried either azathioprine or 6-mercaptopurine

DIAG_JIA.name: Diagnosis of Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
DIAG_JIA.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis

STEP_JIA_SYSTEMIC.name: Trial of Systemic Medication (JIA)
STEP_JIA_SYSTEMIC.description: Patient has tried one other systemic medication for this condition
STEP_JIA_SYSTEMIC.policy_text: Patient has tried one other systemic medication for this condition

CLINICAL_JIA_AGGRESSIVE.name: Aggressive Disease (JIA)
CLINICAL_JIA_AGGRESSIVE.description: Patient has aggressive disease, as determined by the prescriber
CLINICAL_JIA_AGGRESSIVE.policy_text: Patient has aggressive disease, as determined by the prescriber

DIAG_PYODERMA.name: Diagnosis of Pyoderma Gangrenosum
DIAG_PYODERMA.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Pyoderma Gangrenosum

STEP_PYODERMA_STEROID.name: Trial of Systemic Corticosteroid (Pyoderma)
STEP_PYODERMA_STEROID.description: Patient has tried one systemic corticosteroid
STEP_PYODERMA_STEROID.policy_text: Patient has tried one systemic corticosteroid

STEP_PYODERMA_IMMUNO.name: Trial of Immunosuppressant (Pyoderma)
STEP_PYODERMA_IMMUNO.description: Patient has tried one other immunosuppressant for at least 2 months or was intolerant
STEP_PYODERMA_IMMUNO.policy_text: Patient has tried one other immunosuppressant for at least 2 months or was intolerant to one of these medications

DIAG_SARCOIDOSIS.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Sarcoidosis

STEP_SARCOID_STEROID.description: Patient has tried at least one corticosteroid
STEP_SARCOID_STEROID.policy_text: Patient has tried at least one corticosteroid

STEP_SARCOID_IMMUNO.name: Trial of Immunosuppressive (Sarcoidosis)
STEP_SARCOID_IMMUNO.description: Patient has tried at least one immunosuppressive medication
STEP_SARCOID_IMMUNO.policy_text: Patient has tried at least one immunosuppressive medication

DIAG_SCLERITIS.name: Diagnosis of Scleritis or Sterile Corneal Ulceration
DIAG_SCLERITIS.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Scleritis or Sterile Corneal Ulceration

STEP_SCLERITIS_THERAPY.name: Trial of Therapy (Scleritis)
STEP_SCLERITIS_THERAPY.description: Patient has tried one other therapy for this condition (NSAIDs, corticosteroids, immunosuppressants)
STEP_SCLERITIS_THERAPY.policy_text: Patient has tried one other therapy for this condition

DIAG_SPONDYLOARTHRITIS_OTHER.name: Diagnosis of Spondyloarthritis (Other Subtypes)
DIAG_SPONDYLOARTHRITIS_OTHER.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Spondyloarthritis, Other Subtypes (e.g., undifferentiated arthritis, non-radiographic axial spondylitis, Reactive Arthritis)

CLINICAL_SPA_PERIPHERAL.name: Peripheral Arthritis (SpA)
CLINICAL_SPA_PERIPHERAL.description: Patient has arthritis primarily in the knees, ankles, elbows, wrists, hands, and/or feet AND has tried at least ONE conventional synthetic DMARD
CLINICAL_SPA_PERIPHERAL.policy_text: Patient has arthritis primarily in the knees, ankles, elbows, wrists, hands, and/or feet AND has tried at least ONE conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD)

CLINICAL_SPA_AXIAL.name: Axial Spondyloarthritis
CLINICAL_SPA_AXIAL.description: Patient has axial spondyloarthritis with objective signs of inflammation (elevated CRP or Sacroiliitis on MRI)
CLINICAL_SPA_AXIAL.policy_text: Patient has axial spondyloarthritis with objective signs of inflammation

DIAG_STILLS.name: Diagnosis of Still's Disease
DIAG_STILLS.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Still's Disease

STEP_STILLS_DMARD.name: Trial of DMARD (Still's)
STEP_STILLS_DMARD.description: Patient has tried one conventional synthetic DMARD given for at least 2 months or was intolerant
STEP_STILLS_DMARD.policy_text: Patient has tried one conventional synthetic disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) given for at least 2 months or was intolerant

DIAG_UVEITIS.name: Diagnosis of Uveitis
DIAG_UVEITIS.description: Patient has a diagnosis of Uveitis (including posterior uveitides and panuveitis syndromes)

STEP_UVEITIS_THERAPY.name: Trial of Therapy (Uveitis)
STEP_UVEITIS_THERAPY.description: Patient has tried one of the following therapies: periocular, intraocular, or systemic corticosteroids, or immunosuppressives
STEP_UVEITIS_THERAPY.policy_text: Patient has tried one of the following therapies: periocular, intraocular, or systemic corticosteroids, or immunosuppressives

PRIOR_BIOLOGIC_TRIAL.name: Prior Biologic Trial
PRIOR_BIOLOGIC_TRIAL.description: Patient has already tried at least one biologic other than the requested medication (biosimilars do not count)
PRIOR_BIOLOGIC_TRIAL.policy_text: Patient has already tried at least one biologic other than the requested medication

SAFETY_TB_SCREENING_NEGATIVE.name: Tuberculosis Screening Negative
SAFETY_TB_SCREENING_NEGATIVE.description: Patient has completed tuberculosis screening with negative result prior to initiating biologic therapy
SAFETY_TB_SCREENING_NEGATIVE.policy_text: Prior to initiating therapy, patient must have tuberculosis screening with negative result. Acceptable tests include QuantiFERON-TB Gold, T-SPOT.TB, or PPD with chest X-ray.

SAFETY_HEPATITIS_B_SCREENING.name: Hepatitis B Screening Completed
SAFETY_HEPATITIS_B_SCREENING.description: Patient has completed hepatitis B screening panel (HBsAg, anti-HBc, anti-HBs) prior to initiating biologic therapy
SAFETY_HEPATITIS_B_SCREENING.policy_text: Prior to initiating therapy, patient must have hepatitis B screening including HBsAg, anti-HBc, and anti-HBs to rule out active or chronic hepatitis B infection.

SAFETY_HEPATITIS_C_SCREENING.name: Hepatitis C Screening Completed
SAFETY_HEPATITIS_C_SCREENING.description: Patient has completed hepatitis C antibody screening prior to initiating biologic therapy
SAFETY_HEPATITIS_C_SCREENING.policy_text: Prior to initiating therapy, patient should have hepatitis C screening to identify patients at risk for HCV reactivation.

CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_6MO.name: Established on Therapy (6 months)
CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_6MO.description: Patient has been established on therapy for at least 6 months
CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_6MO.policy_text: Patient has been established on therapy for at least 6 months

CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_3MO.name: Established on Therapy (3 months)
CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_3MO.description: Patient has been established on therapy for at least 3 months
CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_3MO.policy_text: Patient has been established on therapy for at least 3 months

CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_1MO.name: Established on Therapy (1 month)
CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_1MO.description: Patient has been established on therapy for at least 1 month
CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_1MO.policy_text: Patient has been established on an infliximab product for at least 1 month

CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_4MO.name: Established on Therapy (4 months)
CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_4MO.description: Patient has been established on therapy for at least 4 months
CONTINUATION_ESTABLISHED_4MO.policy_text: Patient has been established on therapy for at least 4 months

RESPONSE_OBJECTIVE.name: Objective Clinical Response
RESPONSE_OBJECTIVE.description: Patient experienced a beneficial clinical response when assessed by at least one objective measure
RESPONSE_OBJECTIVE.policy_text: When assessed by at least one objective measure, patient experienced a beneficial clinical response from baseline

RESPONSE_SUBJECTIVE.name: Subjective Symptom Improvement
RESPONSE_SUBJECTIVE.description: Patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom
RESPONSE_SUBJECTIVE.policy_text: Compared with baseline, patient experienced an improvement in at least one symptom

CRIT_CONCURRENT_BIOLOGIC.name: Concurrent Biologic/Targeted Synthetic
CRIT_CONCURRENT_BIOLOGIC.description: Medication administered in combination with another biologic or targeted synthetic oral small molecule drug
CRIT_CONCURRENT_BIOLOGIC.policy_text: This medication should not be administered in combination with another biologic or with a targeted synthetic oral small molecule drug

GRP_SAFETY_SCREENING_BIOLOGIC.name: Pre-Biologic Safety Screening
GRP_SAFETY_SCREENING_BIOLOGIC.description: Required safety screenings prior to initiating biologic therapy to rule out latent infections

GRP_CD_INITIAL.name: Crohn's Disease Initial Criteria
GRP_CD_INITIAL.description: Initial approval criteria for Infliximab in Crohn's Disease including safety screening requirements

indication_codes.display: Ankylosing spondylitis of multiple sites in spine
Crohn's disease of both small and large intestine
Crohn's disease of small intestine with fistula
Crohn's disease of large intestine with fistula
Crohn's disease of both small and large intestine with fistula

dosing_requirements.notes: Doses administered no more frequently than once weekly

dosing_requirements.frequency: Baseline, then up to 3 additional doses at 2, 6, 8 weeks

exclusions.name: Concurrent Biologic Therapy
exclusions.description: Cannot be used with another biologic or targeted synthetic oral small molecule drug for an inflammatory condition
exclusions.policy_text: This medication should not be administered in combination with another biologic or with a targeted synthetic oral small molecule drug used for an inflammatory condition

safety_screenings.name: Tuberculosis Screening
safety_screenings.description: Prior to initiating biologic therapy, patient must have tuberculosis screening with negative result
safety_screenings.if_positive: Treatment for latent TB must be initiated before starting biologic therapy

safety_screenings.name: Hepatitis B Screening
safety_screenings.description: Prior to initiating biologic therapy, patient must have hepatitis B panel to rule out active or chronic infection
safety_screenings.if_positive: Consult hepatologist; may require antiviral prophylaxis during biologic therapy

safety_screenings.name: Hepatitis C Screening
safety_screenings.description: Prior to initiating biologic therapy, patient should have hepatitis C antibody screening
safety_screenings.if_positive: Consult hepatologist; assess viral load and liver function
